column4: Hi, I'm trying to install ubuntu on a powerpc using xfs.  When it boots for the first time, I get "kernel panic: vfs: unable to mount root fs on unknown-block(0,0)".
do you know in which partition you installed ubuntu ?
(I'm now booting from a live cd to check it.)
ok, then in grub (the start menu at boot) go to the ubuntu entry and press "e", then edit the "hd(0,0)" to "hd(0,2)" and press "b"
oskide: But I'll try to see if I can do it on yaboot.
theres allso away booting through "open firmware" (if your mac has it)
[A] ndy80, have you looken under System>Preferences or >Administration ? (i never had/used suspend, sry)

yaboot tells me that I caould specify "device" and "partno" parameters, and that if I don't, the defaults are "device=/pci@f40000000/ata-6@d/disk@0" and "partition=3".  So yaboot must be having the correct information.
I think I'd like to have an ext3 root partition of, say 300M,
and have all the rest in another partition (I think the problem could be the xfs).
Is it possible to install ubuntu in such a way that /var, /usr and /home are all in the same partition?
you can have all (except swap) in one partition
if you just define "/" partition at install, all others are in there
